macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Mixed on January 27 Ahead of Fed Decision
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.4% to 6,978.60 and Nasdaq gained 0.9% to 23,817.10, while Dow fell 0.8% to 49,003.41 amid mixed earnings from UnitedHealth, GM, and big tech positioning.

items.title: Saxo Bank Market Quick Take: US Equities Up, Focus on Fed Meeting
items.summary: Dow rose 0.6% to 49,412.40, S&P 500 up 0.5% to 6,950.23, Nasdaq +0.4% to 23,601.36 as investors position for Fed decision on January 27-28; Apple +3%, Tesla -3.1%; VIX stable at 16.15.

items.title: Conference Board Consumer Confidence Plummets to 84.5 in January
items.summary: Consumer Confidence Index fell sharply from 94.2 in December to 84.5, with current conditions at 65.1 below recession threshold of 80; stock market expectations remain high despite souring sentiment.

items.title: Markets Eye Federal Reserve Decision Amid Stable Volatility
items.summary: Investors anticipate unchanged rates at Fed meeting January 27-28, highly sensitive to Powell's comments on inflation and cuts; VIX holds near mid-teens, short-dated volatility drops.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin ETFs Record $1.1B Weekly Outflows Amid Market Lows
items.summary: Bitcoin hit 2026 lows with support at $86,000 as ETFs saw net outflows of $1,137.4M from Jan 20-26, the heaviest since early January. Stablecoin supply contracted by $3.2B, led by USDC burns.

items.title: Markets Brace for FOMC Meeting Volatility on January 28
items.summary: Crypto markets await the FOMC meeting on Jan 28, 2026, expected to drive Bitcoin volatility near $88,000 and XRP consolidation between $1.88-$2.06. Historical data shows BTC pullbacks post-FOMC meetings.

items.title: FOMC and Oil Data Set for 'Super Wednesday' Bitcoin Test
items.summary: January 28 dubbed 'Super Wednesday' with Fed rate decision and US oil inventories potentially swaying BTC, trading between $87K-$89K after a 3.6% weekly drop. Analysts note high volatility risks tied to inflation and liquidity.

items.title: CLARITY Act Markup Delayed Over Industry Disagreement
items.summary: Senate Banking Committee postponed Jan 15 markup of crypto legislation after Coinbase withdrew support due to stablecoin yield restrictions. White House crypto czar urges resolution ahead of late January rescheduling.

items.title: Bitcoin Funding Rates Compress as Long Bias Persists
items.summary: BTC funding averaged +0.42% (58% APR), ETH +0.37%, SOL +0.10% over 7 days ending Jan 26, showing positive but compressed rates indicating reduced leverage unwinding.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Revolutionizes Quantum Field Theory Simulations
items.summary: Researchers from TU Wien and international teams developed AI-designed lattice formulations using custom neural networks to dramatically improve the accuracy and efficiency of quantum field theory simulations, even on coarse grids. This breakthrough enables complex particle-physics simulations with lower computational costs while preserving key physical properties.

items.title: D-Wave Secures $10M Quantum Computing as a Service Deal with Fortune 100 Company
items.summary: D-Wave Quantum Inc. announced a landmark two-year, $10 million QCaaS agreement with a Fortune 100 company on January 27, 2026, to develop quantum-powered applications using their annealing and gate-model systems. The deal highlights growing enterprise adoption of D-Wave's production-grade quantum technology.

items.title: Research Shows Predictive AI Boosts Chatbot Effectiveness in Customer Service
items.summary: A UNC Kenan-Flagler study found that AI agents predicting the specific package in customer inquiries improved satisfaction by 6.4%, reduced call times by 7.7%, and lowered transfers to humans. Correct predictions build trust, enhancing AI-human interactions in e-commerce.

items.title: 2026 Tech Trends Highlight Agentic AI and GenAI for Business Automation
items.summary: DocuWare's 2026 trends report emphasizes generative AI for document processing, agentic AI for independent task handling, and AI-powered compliance in enterprise software. The focus shifts to measurable ROI and business outcomes over mere features.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: StarRupture Hits 500,000 Sales in Under 2 Weeks on Steam Early Access
items.summary: Polish studio Creepy Jar's first-person open-world base-building game StarRupture has sold 500,000 copies in just 11 days since its Early Access launch, marking the first big hit of 2026 on Steam.

items.title: Godot 4.6 Released with New Visual Design and Workflow Improvements
items.summary: The open-source game engine Godot 4.6 has launched, featuring a refreshed look and a commitment to prioritizing developer workflow enhancements.

items.title: Valve Faces Lawsuit Over Excessive Steam Developer Commissions
items.summary: A British tribunal has ruled that Valve must face a lawsuit alleging it charges publishers excessive commissions on the Steam platform.

items.title: Capcom Reports Record Video Game Sales Over Past Nine Months
items.summary: Capcom has sold a record number of video games in the past nine months, highlighting strong business performance amid industry challenges.

items.title: RuneScape Reaches $3 Billion in Lifetime Revenue
items.summary: The long-running MMORPG RuneScape has surpassed $3 billion in lifetime revenue, underscoring its enduring success.

items.title: Micro-Indie Publisher Pantaloon Closes Pre-Seed Funding Round
items.summary: Pantaloon, a micro-indie game publisher, has successfully closed its pre-seed funding round to support further growth.

items.title: US Congress Members Express Concern Over Saudi-Led EA Buyout
items.summary: Congress members have voiced serious concerns regarding a potential Saudi-led acquisition of Electronic Arts.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Microsoft Issues Emergency Patch for Office Zero-Day Under Active Attack
items.summary: Microsoft released an urgent patch for high-severity zero-day vulnerability CVE-2026-21509 in Microsoft Office, which bypasses key security features and is being exploited in targeted attacks worldwide.

items.title: Elon Musk Predicts Space-Based Solar-Powered Data Centers in 2-3 Years
items.summary: Elon Musk stated at Davos that space-based solar-powered data centers could be the lowest-cost option within two to three years, leveraging SpaceX's Starship for cheap access and superior cooling in space.

items.title: Big Tech Earnings Season Kicks Off with Focus on Capex and Cash Flow
items.summary: Investors await Tesla and Meta earnings on January 28, scrutinizing automotive cash generation, advertising performance, and capital discipline amid heavy infrastructure spending, with supplier results signaling sustained demand.
